newsitem.title: FRANCE: MTV Europe targets France in advertising campaign.
newsitem.headline: MTV Europe targets France in advertising campaign.

text.p: Music channel MTV Europe plans to launch an advertising and marketing campaign aimed at winning over the French public, MTV Networks Europe said in a statement.
Based on a play on words in French, "Je t'MTV" (je t'aime -- I love you), the campaign hopes to boost subscriptions from young French television viewers.
MTV Europe, received in 1.3 million homes, is carried on the satellite offering from CanalSatellite and on French cable networks.

The campaign is to start on March 1 and run for two months, both in magazines for young people like Max, Les Inrockuptibles, Jeune et Jolie, and on specialist music radio channels like FUN, NRJ, Skyrock, Nova and FG.
The campaign is being run by an independent advertising team led by Jean-Philippe Verdin and Damon Fischer.
